700157f-a.title: Bronx: 156th Street (East) - Beck Street
700157f-a.text:
(1)
East 156th Street, south side, between Beck and Fox Streets,
showing the White Mansion and part of the estate. It was formerly
located (1868 map) between Southern Boulevard and Leggett Lane
slightly north of their junction. Randall Comfort states that the
spot in the foreground marks the site of an old Revolutionary cave
in which the remains of Americansoldiers were found. The G.W.Bromley
map of 1923 as revised to September 1932, shows the site to be
occupied by a 2-story brick building known as the Martinique Club.
The aforementioned location refers to the exact site of the mansion.
1900.
Gift of Randall Comfort.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, as viewed from a different angle, showing the side and
rear of the mansion. Cocfort states that the summer house (right
foregrund) stands on a boulder said to mark the grave of an old
Indian chief.
1898.
Gift of Randall Comfort.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
A front view of the mansion at a later date. It was the home of
the Unity Club of the Bronx at the date of this photograph.
1915.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
